Best viewed in 1024x768
 

Basic TI-86 Asm Information

The TI-86 is the newest Texas Instruments Graphic Calculators of the Z80 line. The TI-86 is a hybrid of the TI-85 and TI-83. Along with a slick screen, more memory, and assembly support, no wonder why the TI-86 has become so popular!  The TI-89 is newer than the TI-86, but I still like the TI-86 better.  Go figure.

Basic Assembly Information

How to transfer a program to your calculator, run an asm program, or troubleshoot what may be wrong

This is all explained in my first programming tutorial, The Basics

How to display a program as a series of hex codes:

Two choices:
  • Use TASM -80 -h ProgramName.asm

    • Where ProgramName.asm is the name of your program. And it will produce a listing file called ProgramName.lst This file contains the hex codes to the right of the autoincrementing number. It is fairly obvious.

  • Use the program TI-86 Program --> Hex Converter to easily convert the specified program into a hex listing.

How to enter a program via hex codes:

Press [PGRM][F2] (Edit)

Name=(Enter name here)

Then a : prompt comes up.

Press [2nd][Custom][F1] then move to AsmPgrm and press enter twice.

:AsmPgrm
:

To enter a letter select [ALPHA] then the letter
To enter a number simply select the number

Press enter for each new group of hex codes.

The program automatically gets saved everytime you select a character.
Use the arrow keys and [DEL] key to edit a line.

Specs and Advantages of the TI-86

  • 6 MHZ Zilog Z80
  • 128K RAM with 96K user-available, 4x as much as the TI-85.
  • Official Assembly Language support
  • Graphs - Functions, polar, parametric, and differential equations in up to 7 different graphing styles
  • Powerful calculus features - Integration, derivatives, minimums, maximums, roots, and arcs.
  • Function evaluation table - Evaluate graphs in the TI-83 style table format.
  • TI-83 style list and matrix editor improvements - Allows data exploration for lists up to 6,000 elements long and up to 80 x 80 matrices.
  • Assembly Language Programming - In addition to the regular programming capabilities, the TI-86 also supports Z80 assembly language programming.
  • Replay and edit - Recall prior homescreen entries using deep recall
  • Input/Output port, ability to link to a computer
  • Nice LCD screen - Shows 8 lines of 21 characters each or 64 x 128 pixel screen plus two levels of display menus.
  • Tables - Function evaluation table shows numeric output for function, polar, parametric, and differential equation modes.
  • Keyboard entries - Improved interactive graphing. Choose from a line graph, thick line graph, improved shading, and more. Enter specific values at prompts for math operations and during tracing.
  • New list editor - View multiple lists at one time in an improved stat/list editor. Attach formulas to lists for automatic computation.
  • Differential equations - Solve nine first-order differential equations or up to one ninth-order differential equation. Easily solve a family of curves with a list of initial values. Interactively select initial conditions via the graph screen.
  • Slope & direction fields - Additional tools for exploring differential equations. Pause first or immediately follow the slope or direction field with a graph of the solution or a family of solutions. In addition, choose from two methods (RK and Euler) to solve your differential equations.
  • Equation solving tools -Interactively solve for any variable in an equation with the built-in SOLVER. Build a library of equations to solve and share via the link port. Simultaneous equation solver. Polynomial root finder solves real and complex polynomials up to 30th order.
  • New matrix editor - The TI-86 contains enhanced tools for solving a variety of linear algebra problems. Matrix abilities include: eigenvalues, eigenvectors, determinates, ref, rref and more.
  • Most powerful calculator that is still allowed on the SAT's (and most other standard tests)
  • Cost: $120
 

Advanced Specifications:

  • 8-line by 21-character display.
  • Advanced functions accessed through redefinable menu keys.
  • Real and complex numbers calculated to 14-digit accuracy and displayed with 12-digits plus 3-digit exponent.
  • Up to 99 traceable graphing functions defined, saved, graphed and analyzed at one time.
  • 7 different graphing styles.
  • Function evaluation table.
  • Graphs parametric equations, polar equations, and solutions to differential equations.
  • 16 interactive zoom features.
  • Simultaneous graphing of more than one function.
  • Operates on lists of numbers as well as single numbers.
  • Real and complex matrices with dimensions up to 80 x 80.
  • Additional data types include strings, pictures, and vectors.
  • TI-83 style list and matrix editor improvements.
  • List-based one- and two-variable statistical analysis, including linear, logarithmic, exponential, power, sine, logistic, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th order polynomial regressions.
  • Systems-of-equation solving, polynomial-root solving.
  • Build a custom equation library to store, analyze, or solve for any unknown variable.
  • Replay and edit up to 10 homescreen entries using deep recall.
  • Optional Machine Language programming with number of programs limited only by available memory.
  • 128K RAM with 96K user-available.
  • Slope and direction fields for exploring differential equations.
  • RK and Euler differential equation solve methods.
  • Executes TI-85 programs.
  • TI-tested Machine Language program applications available for download from worldwide web* (Inferential Statistics, Distributions, and Finance).
  • Link capabilities for data transfer through I/O port.
  • Unit-to-unit link included.
  • Accessories allow information to be transferred to a computer and be printed or stored on disk.
  • Overhead projector unit available - compatible with TI-85 ViewScreen™ LCD.
  • Compatible with the Calculator-Based Laboratory™ (CBL™) and Calculator-Based Ranger™ (CBR) Systems to allow analysis of real-world data.
  • Powered by 4 AAA batteries with a lithium battery backup to protect memory during main battery change.
  • Impact-resistant slide case.
  • Teacher Pack available (includes ten calculators and guidebooks with classroom poster).
  • Toll-free hotline.
  • Calculator poster and keyboard transparency available.
  • One-year limited warranty.
  • Volume Purchase Program: proofs of purchase redeemable for additional product.
  • Workshop Loan Program.
  • Applications newsletter available free of charge.
  • Guidebook included.
